alert.note: Alert for Central Middlesex County; Southeast Middlesex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 3:13PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Middlesex County through 400 PM EDT... At 312 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lincoln, or near Lexington, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Torrential downpours could lead to localized minor street flooding. Locations impacted include... Billerica, Woburn, Lexington, Tewksbury, Burlington, Wilmington, Stoneham, Winchester, Concord, Bedford and Lincoln. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
